title: Overblown claims, PR stunts and ‘dumb’ AI. What’s going wrong at Musk’s research lab?
text:
In the back of the room of Number 10 on Boris Johnson’s first day as Prime Minister, Dominic Cummings exuded casual, brainy nonchalance. His dress-down look wasn’t unprecedented for a policy guru – David Cameron adviser Steve Hilton had famously padded around Whitehall barefoot – but the branding of his T-shirt signalled a new force in the corridors of power.

Cummings had chosen to sport merchandise promoting the artificial intelligence (AI) research lab started by Elon Musk, OpenAI. He had made several visits to the lab and cited its work on his famously verbose blog. With Cummings on board, the Johnson administration would benefit from insights from the frontier of the Fourth Industrial Revolution....
description: In the back of the room of Number 10 on Boris Johnson’s first day as Prime Minister, Dominic Cummings exuded casual, brainy nonchalance.
